actions: With Shu Di Huang, for Qi and Yin Deficiency.
Nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin, nourishes Jing and Blood and fills the Marrow.
With Shan Zhu Yu, for Nourishes Kidney Yin and secures Jing, while restraining urination and sweating.
With Shan Zhu Yu and Shan Yao, for dizziness, weak and sore low back, infertility and night sweats, due to Kidney and Liver Yin Deficiency.
Tonifies Kidney Yin and astringes Jing.
With Shan Zhu Yu and Tu Si Zi, for leukorrhea due to Spleen and Kidney Deficiency.
Stabilizes the Kidneys, astringes Jing and Body Fluids, tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin, strengthens Kidney Yang, stabilizes the menses and stops bleeding.
With Wu Wei Zi, for Yin and Yang Deficiency of the Liver and Kidneys.
With Shu Di Huang and Shan Yao, a basic combination to tonify the Kidneys.
Strengthens Yang, nourishes Yin, astringes Jing and urine, benefits the marrow and tonifies the Kidneys and Liver.
Calms the Spirit, sedates the Heart and clears the channel joining the Heart and Kidney.
Tonifies the Kidneys, astringes Jing and tonifies Qi.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
Nourish the Kidney Yin and Yang

symptoms: Decreased menses with light colored Blood and no blood clots
Long-drawn-out urination with a thin stream or dribbling
Pain and coldness in loin and knees
manifestations.tongue: Red or Pale, swollen and wet
manifestations.pulse: Thready and rapid or Floating and Empty or Deep and weak or Thin and soft or Deep and thready
